newsitem.title: SWEDEN: AssiDoman says in jv to invest $100 mln in Karelia.
newsitem.headline: AssiDoman says in jv to invest $100 mln in Karelia.

text.p: Swedish forestry company AssiDoman said on Tuesday it was investing $100 million in a joint three-year project in Karelia in Russia with Stratton Paper Co.
AssiDoman spokesman Frans Benson told Reuters the investment sum of $100 million was announced for the first time earlier this year.
AssiDoman said in a statement it had been cooperating with Russian pulp and paper producer Segezhabumprom Joint Stock Company in order to revive Segezha's paper sack production industry.
The plan includes modernisation measures and installation of environmental protection systems in the mill.
"Production after investments will be about 450,000 tonnes per year of paper and linerboard," AssiDoman said.
U.S.-owned Stratton Group, set up by investor Michael Dingman, acquired 51 percent of Segezhabumprom for an undisclosed sum earlier this year.
